text: All earthquakes look the same when they start, making it unlikely we will be able to predict which will cause the mostdevastation
. Early warning systems rely on seismometers picking up tremors

and sounding the alarm for nearby cities before major shaking starts. Even a few seconds’ warning can make a lot of difference, both for individual people and for organisations like hospitals. For example, Mexico’s early warning system gave everyone a 10 to 15 second heads-up before Tuesday’smagnitude7.1 earthquake.
